image.altText: A red and black graphic of a crowd in silhouette under a white supremacist flag and the Australian flag.

props.synopsis: As the National Socialist Network follows the script of a far-right playbook in an attempt to position itself as a political movement, there are moves to have it proscribed as a terrorist group.

title.children: How overseas terrorist groups are shaping Australia's far-right

image.altText: A forensic detective

props.synopsis: Two boys, aged 12 and 15, die on the streets of Melbourne after being stabbed in what police believe was a targeted attack.

title.children: Two children dead after 'targeted' Melbourne stabbing attack

image.altText: A graphic of a light bulb and a timeline so symbolise power prices or electricity prices.

props.synopsis: Consumer advocates are calling for an overhaul of the market mechanism that allows wholesale power prices in Australia’s biggest grid to soar to the highest levels in the world.

title.children: Power price spikes and lack of investment spark calls for electricity overhaul

image.altText: An illustration from in the sea looking up at a piece of machinery. Above it light shines through the water.

props.synopsis: A push to extract minerals from the depths of the Pacific Ocean is gaining momentum. Here is how it works and why it has become a global flashpoint.

title.children: Deep below the ocean's surface, a global fight is brewing

image.altText: Albanese and Morrison pull the same pose, listening with each of their fingers entwined

props.synopsis: When he lashed Scott Morrison over the multiple ministries affair, Anthony Albanese said his predecessor "operated in darkness". But this week, a PM with a patchy transparency record of his own announced a plan to dim the lights.

title.children: Albanese scoffed at Morrison's secrecy. Then he copied it

image.altText: A large auditorium with rows of chairs facing three PowerPoint screens

props.synopsis: Türkiye rejects Australia's bid to host the COP31 climate summit in Adelaide.

title.children: Australia and Türkiye fight to host COP31 climate summit

image.altText: A Belarusian tennis player pumps her fist in celebration after a point in the US Open final.

props.synopsis: World number one Aryna Sabalenka successfully defends her US Open title, with a straight sets win in the final against American Amanda Anisimova at Flushing Meadows. Follow live.

title.children: Sabalenka clinches back-to-back US Open titles with win over Anisimova

image.altText: A composite image of First Nations AFL players Jamarra Ugle-Hagan, Jase Burgoyne and Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera

props.synopsis: Ten years after AFL great Adam Goodes was forced to leave the game, Indigenous player numbers have dwindled, online racist abuse is rife and insiders say elite private schools have dramatically narrowed the talent pathways. How can the league turn it around?

title.children: AFL boss concedes funding cuts have hurt First Nations talent pathways

image.altText: Two men shake hands in front of Chinese and Russian flags

props.synopsis: Flanked by the leaders of some of the world's most sanctioned nations, Chinese President Xi Jinping led what some analysts have dubbed an "axis of upheaval" this week.

title.children: Trump's global lesson in how to lose friends and alienate people

image.altText: A woman smiles for a photo while holding a large bouquet of orange flowers and baby's breath

props.synopsis: Sana Yousaf's murder shocked Pakistan. She was one of more than 700 women allegedly murdered in the nation this year alone.

title.children: TikToker's murder exposes dark culture in Pakistan's online spaces

image.altText: Kirsten stands waering a lab coat in the wall walled hallway of a university lab.

props.synopsis: A scientist investigating why pesticides were appearing in marine life discovers a banned chemical on NSW berries. The underwhelming response from the government has exposed regulatory blind spots in the system meant to protect consumers.

title.children: A banned pesticide is showing up in blueberries. No-one can find the source

image.altText: a young man with a moustache sits at a table with his chin in his hand

props.synopsis: As more men are being diagnosed with eating disorders, experts say stereotypes are still making recovery harder.

title.children: More men are getting eating disorders — but stereotypes make recovery harder

image.altText: A house auction in Norwood

props.synopsis: The "inflation nutters" in New Zealand adopted inflation targeting first, and Australia pinched their idea. But the policy has unresolved issues, a former RBA deputy governor says.

title.children: The RBA has never known what to do about property prices, former deputy governor says

image.altText: Boxes of cigarettes surrounded by Australian cash.

props.synopsis: The ABC, via interviews, reviews of court records and attending dozens of illegal stores, can today reveal new details and allegations about the trade.

title.children: Cash, secret rooms, fire bombings: Inside the illegal tobacco trade

image.altText: A man leans on a red park bench.

props.synopsis: Prostate cancer is one of Australia's most commonly diagnosed cancers. One Aussie dad wants men to take it seriously and get checked.

title.children: Forget socks and jocks, this dad wants you to get a PSA for Father's Day

image.altText: Bangor building

props.synopsis: Experts say cost-of-living pressures are impacting child care, with many grandparents being relied on to help ease the burden on struggling parents.

title.children: Sydney childcare centre mix-up puts role of grandparents in spotlight

image.altText: A larger portrait of a teenage boy sits before a crowd of Catholic clergy in white robes and pink skull caps.

props.synopsis: Carlo Acutis, an Italian teenager who died in 2006, will today become the first saint of the internet age.

title.children: First millennial saint to be canonised by Pope Leo at the Vatican

image.altText: d

props.synopsis: The recent protests across Indonesia, and across the globe, wasn't just sparked by public outrage over the generous perks awarded to MPs — but from deeper-rooted problems with the country's democratic system.

title.children: The roots of Indonesians' fury with their political elite run deep

image.altText: A man in a tie leaves the courthouse as journalists and cameramen gather around.

props.synopsis: Now that Matt Wright has been found guilty on two counts of attempting to pervert the course of justice, we can shed light on other legal matters surrounding the celebrity crocodile wrangler.

title.children: What other legal matters is Matt Wright caught up in?

image.altText: Angela in the middle, with each daughter on either side, all in their graduation caps and gowns, smiling outside.

props.synopsis: When Angela Robinson opted for a career change after decades in the police force, she never thought she would end up graduating university with her two daughters.

title.children: 'Not your usual uni experience': Mother graduates with two daughters

image.altText: Three F1 drivers pose, arm in arm, after quailfying in the op

props.synopsis: Australia's F1 world championship leader Oscar Piastri will start from third position on the grid for the Italian Grand Prix at Monza. Here is all you need to know about the race.

title.children: Verstappen completes fastest-ever F1 lap, Piastri starts third in Monza

image.altText: screenshot of instagram video

props.synopsis: Queensland's environment department says it is investigating a video which appears to show an influencer attempting to catch a freshwater crocodile.

title.children: Investigation launched in Queensland over alleged croc snatching video

image.altText: A portrait of Renee Gracie preparing to race in the 2023 GT World Challenge.

props.synopsis: Renee Gracie had her dream career in motorsport, but says sexism and the culture forced her out. OnlyFans kept her afloat in some dark days, and now she's back on the circuit with their support.

title.children: Renee Gracie on how OnlyFans restored her self-esteem and motorsport career

image.altText: A video still of Tom Gleeson behind a podium. The ABC lissajous in the top left corner and the Hard Quiz logo in the top right

props.synopsis: I'll believe it when I see it … Let's play, HARD!

title.children: I know you think you know the answers to this quiz

image.altText: Gold Coast Suns coach Damien Hardwick laughs as he stands in the rooms after a finals win.

props.synopsis: Having lost their past 10 games at the Gabba, the Gold Coast Suns are confident they can buck history in the QClash semifinal against Brisbane after downing Fremantle in Perth.

title.children: Time to knock big brother off Gabba perch, Hardwick says after Suns big finals win

image.altText: Parentline logo

props.synopsis: After 25 years in operation, Victoria's Parentline service will shut on October 31 as the government withdraws funding.

title.children: Victoria to become only state without dedicated helpline for parents

image.altText: An image of a man in a black suit walking and waving

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people, including Italian fashion icon Donatella Versace, have gathered in Milan to farewell Giorgio Armani, after his death at age 91.

title.children: Hundreds of mourners farewell Giorgio Armani in Milan

image.altText: A koala hangs off a tree while looking into the camera.

props.synopsis: The long-touted Great Koala National Park is set to become a reality in New South Wales, protecting koala populations and other threatened species in the state's mid-north.

title.children: Announcement expected to lock in long-awaited Great Koala National Park

image.altText: Teresa Palmer, a blonde woman in her late 30s, with a fringe, poses in front of a turquoise wall.

props.synopsis: From stories based on real-life cults to adaptations of books by some of Australia's favourite authors, these are the TV shows that lured Teresa Palmer back to Aussie shores.

title.children: From Wolf Creek to The Family Next Door: Teresa Palmer lands back home

image.altText: A man in work clothes, wearing a cap and leaning on against an off-road vehicle.

props.synopsis: The trial of celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright unearthed a culture of helicopter maintenance and safety breaches by his company, which some say have been ongoing in Australia's north for decades.

title.children: Cowboy helicopter culture exposed by Matt Wright trial

image.altText: Vladimir Putin, Xi Jinping, and Kim Jong Un walk in tandem, flanked by entourage.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping were caught on an audio recording talking about organ transplants extending life — but there are plenty of biotech startups also looking at increasing human life span, particularly in the US, where many are supported by powerful billionaires.

title.children: Putin and Xi's chat about immortality has parallels to biotech startups

image.altText: A jockey held up by crowd holding a big gold trophy.

props.synopsis: People from across the country travel to Birdsville for the annual races, while an iconic boxing tent marks the end of an era.

title.children: Record year for Birdsville Races as punters come from far and wide

image.altText: A diagram of two frogs, one with tadpoles in it's belly, and another with a frog in it's mouth.

props.synopsis: Nearly two decades ago, scientists in Newcastle came surprisingly close to resurrecting the extinct gastric brooding frog. Their failure highlights issues still plaguing de-extinction research today.

title.children: How a team of Australian scientists almost brought back an extinct frog
